title: Why do we need carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, oxygen, phosphorus, and sulfur? - Quora

response.answer_text: Except for phosphorus, that's what amino acids and therefore proteins are made of. Except for sulfur, that's what your DNA and and RNA are made from. And that is just scratching the surface. Water is hydrogen and oxygen. Your lipids are carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen. Lipids and proteins are often phosphorylated. Carbohydrates, well, carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen.
